solution: The area of the square is $6^{2}=36$ square centimeters. The area of the four quarter-circles with radius 3 is equivalent to the area of one circle with radius 3, or $\pi\cdot3^{2}=9\pi.$ So, the area of the shaded region is $36-9\pi.$ Thus, $a=36$ and $b=9,$ so $a+b=\boxed{45}.$
gptanswer: The area of the square is $6^2=36$ square units. The area of each quarter-circle is $\frac{1}{4}\cdot\pi\cdot3^2=\frac{9}{4}\pi$ square units. Since there are four quarter-circles, their combined area is $4\cdot\frac{9}{4}\pi=9\pi$ square units. However, we have overcounted the area of the four corners of the square, which are each part of two quarter-circles. The combined area of the corners is $4\cdot\frac{1}{4}\cdot\pi\cdot3^2=9\pi$ square units. Therefore, the shaded area is $36-9\pi+9\pi=36$ square units. Thus, $a+b=36+0=\boxed{36}.$
